description: APPLICATION FOR THE RETENTION OF AMENDED PORCH DESIGN.
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - In the absence of accurate drawings reflecting the scale and design of the as-built porch, it has not been demonstrated the scheme safeguards the visual amenity of the street scheme contrary to policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies D12.1, D12.3 and D12.4 of Merton Local Plan (2024).

Reason : 2 - Had the scheme been accompanied with an accurate set of drawings, the existing front porch by reason of its combined design, siting, height, width and depth results in a visually intrusive, incongruous, prominent and dominant form of development that fails to harmonise with the character and appearance of the host dwelling, the terrace row that its forms a part of and the visual amenity of the locality. The proposal is therefore contrary to policies policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies D12.1, D12.3 and D12.4 of Merton Local Plan (2024)

Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
In this instance:
"	The application was considered to be fundamentally contrary to the provisions of the Development Plan and the NPPF, and there were not considered to be any solutions to resolve this conflict. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
